case: The terms may be changed at any time, but you will receive notification of the changes
quoteDoc: Firefox Cloud Services: Terms of Service
quoteText:
Mozilla may update these Terms from time to time to address a new feature of the Services or to clarify a provision.
The updated Terms will be posted online.
If the changes are substantive, we will announce the update through Mozilla's usual channels for such announcements such as blog posts and forums.

case: There is a date of the last update of the agreements
quoteDoc: Firefox Cloud Services: Terms of Service
quoteText: To make your review more convenient, we will post an effective date at the top of this page.

quoteDoc: Firefox Cloud Services: Terms of Service
quoteText: In the event of a conflict between a translated version of these terms and the English language version, the English language version shall control

case: You will be notified if personal data has been affected by data breaches
quoteDoc: Firefox Cloud Services: Terms of Service
quoteText: • Breach Alerts: This notifies you if your email address appears in a new data breach.

case: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and for the activities on your account
quoteDoc: Firefox Cloud Services: Terms of Service
quoteText: It is your responsibility to protect your online accounts using strong and different passwords, security questions, two-factor authentication, password managers, and other safety measures.

case: Many third parties are involved in operating the service
quoteText:
We may also use cookies, device information, and IP addresses, along with clear GIFs, cookies and third party services to help us understand in the aggregate how users engage with our products, services, communications, websites, online campaigns, snippets, devices, and other platforms. We use:

  • Google Analytics, which places a cookie on your device, to obtain metrics on how users engage with our websites. This helps us to improve site content.
  • Convert.com and ShareProgress, which place a cookie on your device, to help us test variations of web content. This helps us offer better web experiences to users.
  • DoubleClick and Flashtalking, each of which uses a clear GIF on our download Firefox page. This helps us measure the effectiveness of our advertising campaigns.
  • Yahoo Dot Pixel, which uses JavaScript on our download Firefox page. This helps us measure the effectiveness of our advertising campaigns.
  • HTTP Referral Data, which may be included with Firefox’s installer, to understand the website domain or advertising campaign that referred you to our download page.

case: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service
quoteText: Cookie History: You can accept or decline individual cookies in your Firefox preferences in the Tools/Options/Privacy history section. Note that certain features of our products and services may not function properly without the aid of cookies.

case: Third-party cookies are used for advertising
quoteText:
Some Mozilla.org pages use clear GIFs which communicate with DoubleClick to understand the effectiveness of our advertising campaigns.
you can control personalized ads from DoubleClick in Google's ad settings (you will be prompted to sign into your Google Account)

quoteDoc: Firefox Cloud Services: Terms of Service
quoteText: You can change your email subscriptions with Mozilla from our emails (click the link at the bottom) or from the browser (visit Firefox / Preferences / Sync / Manage Account / Email Preferences).

case: This service offers a symbolic but nonbinding statement about a matter of opinion, ethics, society, or politics
quoteText: At Mozilla, we believe that privacy is fundamental to a healthy internet.

case: Your IP address is collected, which can be used to view your approximate location
quoteText: Location data: When you first use Firefox, it uses your IP address to set your default search provider based on your country.

case: Information is provided about how your personal data is used
quoteText: In this Privacy Notice, we explain what data Firefox shares and point you to settings to share even less.

case: Only aggregate data is given to third parties
quoteText: We also share aggregated data about the sponsored content you see and click

case: Logs are deleted after a finite period of time
quoteText: System logs of your DNS requests are deleted from the service within 24 hours

case: Extra data may be collected about you through promotions
quoteText: as well as basic data about your interactions with Firefox’s suggested content. This includes the number of times suggested content is displayed or clicked.

case: Your personal data is not shared with third parties
quoteText: Firefox does not share your IP address or any other information that could be used to identify you with either Amazon or AdMarketplace.

case: First-party cookies are used
quoteText: We base the recommendations in about:addons on a cookie.

case: Information is provided about security practices
quoteText: To help protect you from malicious downloads, Firefox sends basic information about unrecognized downloads to Google's SafeBrowsing Service, including the filename and the URL it was downloaded from.

case: This service tracks which web page referred you to it
quoteText:
Firefox by default sends Mozilla HTTP data that may be included with Firefox’s installer.
This enables us to determine the website domain or advertising campaign (if any) that referred you to our download page.

case: Pseudonyms are allowed
quoteText: display name

case: Information is provided about security practices
quoteText:
For security purposes, we store the IP addresses used to access your Firefox Account in order to approximate your city and country.
We use this data to send you email alerts if we detect suspicious activity, such as account logins from other locations.

case: You are informed about the risk of publishing personal info online
quoteText: Please minimize the personal information you choose to share on these forums because your comments may be accessible to the public.

case: You can request access, correction and/or deletion of your data
quoteText: see here to manage account data

case: You are tracked via web beacons, tracking pixels, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting
quoteText: We may use cookies, clear GIFs, third party web analytics

case: Third-party cookies are used for statistics
quoteText: Google Analytics, which places a cookie on your device, to obtain metrics on how users engage with our websites.

case: The service deletes tracking data after a period of time and allows you to opt out
quoteText: You can control individual cookie preferences, indicate your cookie preferences to others, and opt-out of web analytics and optimization tools.

case: Your browser's Do Not Track (DNT) headers are respected
quoteText: If you have configured your browser to send a “Do Not Track” signal when accessing our websites, Mozilla will not utilize any of the tools described in the Metrics section.

case: Your information is only shared with third parties when given specific consent
quoteText:
When do we share your information with others?
<ul>
<li>When we have asked and received your permission to share it.

case: Third parties used by the service are bound by confidentiality obligations
quoteText: For processing or providing products and services to you, but only if those entities receiving your information are contractually obligated to handle the data in ways that are approved by Mozilla.

case: The service promises to inform and/or notify you regarding government inquiries that may involve your personal data
quoteText:
We follow the law whenever we receive requests about you from a government or related to a lawsuit.
We'll notify you when we're asked to hand over your personal information in this way unless we're legally prohibited from doing so.

case: The service will only respond to government requests that are reasonable
quoteText: When we receive requests like this, we'll only release your personal information if we have a good faith belief that the law requires us to do so.

case: Your personal data may be sold or otherwise transferred as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction
quoteText: If our organizational structure or status changes (if we undergo a restructuring, are acquired, or go bankrupt) we may pass your information to a successor or affiliate.

case: The data retention period is kept to the minimum necessary for fulfilling its purposes
quoteText:
We also don't want your personal information for any longer than we need it, so we only keep it long enough to do what we collected it for.
Once we don't need it, we take steps to destroy it unless we are required by law to keep it longer.
